entries.title: US Downs Chinese Balloon Off Carolina Coast, AP Says
entries.description: The US has downed an alleged Chinese spy balloon off the Carolina coast and an operation is underway to recover the debris, the Associated Press reported on Saturday.

entries.title: South African Deputy President Mabuza Quits Ahead of Cabinet Reshuffle
entries.description: South African Deputy President David Mabuza resigned, clearing the way for Paul Mashatile, the new deputy leader of the governing African National Congress, to succeed him.

entries.title: US Downs Chinese Balloon Off Carolina Coast, AP Reports
entries.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — US has downed the Chinese balloon off the Carolina coast and an operation is underway to recover the debris.

entries.title: President Biden on China’s Balloon: ‘We’re Going to Take Care of It’
entries.description: President Joe Biden said the US will “take care of” an alleged Chinese surveillance balloon that flew over the country and prompted Secretary of State Antony Blinken to postpone an official trip to China.

entries.title: Jobs Galore Give US Consumers Firepower to Fight Off Recession
entries.description: Don’t count the US consumer out just yet.

entries.title: A Balloon Roils US-China Ties, Strikes Hit UK: Weekend Reads
entries.description: A Chinese surveillance balloon spotted at high altitude over sensitive US nuclear sites prompted the US to postpone Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s trip to Beijing. China said it drifted into American airspace by accident.

entries.title: UK Online Safety Bill May Also Tackle Misogyny
entries.description: The UK’s Online Safety Bill may be strengthened to tackle violence and abuse against women on the web, according to a report in The Telegraph newspaper.

entries.title: China Weekly Covid Deaths Halve as Country Returns From Holiday
entries.description: China’s official Covid death tally almost halved in the seven days following the Spring Festival Holiday, suggesting the massive wave of infections that spread across the country in the past few weeks may be abating.

entries.title: Forget Trump, Democrats Are Preparing Ways to Beat a DeSantis Campaign
entries.description: Age, experience could be DeSantis strengths with Biden voters

entries.title: Your Saturday UK Briefing: FTSE at a Record as Sunak Completes 100 Days
entries.description: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter with Allegra StrattonHello there. This did not seem like the kind of week when you’d expect the FTSE 100 to close at a record.

entries.title: Dozens of Soldiers Freed in Russia-Ukraine Prisoner Swap
entries.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Dozens of Russian and Ukrainian prisoners of war have returned home following a prisoner swap, officials on both sides said Saturday.

entries.title: Russian Tycoon May Buy Germany’s Insolvent Hahn Airport
entries.description: The Russian owner of Germany’s legendary Nuerburgring motor racing track is set to buy insolvent Frankfurt-Hahn Airport in western Germany, Deutsche Presse-Agentur reported on Friday.

entries.title: Charting the Global Economy: Fed, BOE, ECB Near Peak Rate Levels
entries.description: The Federal Reserve, Bank of England and European Central Bank all conceded that while inflation is cooling in their respective regions, more interest-rate hikes are needed to ensure price stability.

entries.title: US Considers Plan to Down Chinese Balloon Over Atlantic: AP
entries.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Biden administration is moving forward with a plan to shoot down a large Chinese balloon suspected of conducting surveillance on the U.S. military, by bringing it down once it is above the Atlantic Ocean where the remnants could potentially be recovered, according to two U.S. officials.

entries.title: Ex-Tory Chairman Calls for Dominic Raab to Be Suspended Over Bullying Claims
entries.description: Former Tory Party chairman Sir Jake Berry has called for Deputy Prime Minister Dominic Raab to be suspended while he is investigated over claims he bullied officials.

entries.title: Sunak’s Tories Have a £25 Million Black Hole to Fill as Donors Flee
entries.description: As Conservatives trail in the polls, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak searches for a successor to Nadhim Zahawi as the ruling party’s chairman.

entries.title: France Demands Transparency to Defuse Subsidy Fight With the US
entries.description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire will head to meetings with counterparts in Washington on Tuesday demanding more transparency from President Joe Biden’s administration on green industry subsidies, in order to avoid an escalation of transatlantic trade tensions.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: US Humanitarian Aid Worker Killed in Bakhmut
entries.description: The US is sending Ukraine a new $2.1 billion weapons package, the Pentagon said Friday, including a new ground-launched, bomb-tipped rocket.

entries.title: The EU’s Ban on Russian Diesel Won’t Really Stop Fuel Flows
entries.description: New measure means the bloc will lose its biggest supplier of the fuel

entries.title: German Energy Reprieve Too Little, Too Late to Save Factory Jobs
entries.description: With gas prices down from record highs, Germany has seen a surge of optimism that the worst of the energy crisis has passed. But for the country’s biggest industrial producers, the long-term picture remains dismal.

entries.title: Scholz Is Learning That It’s Not Easy Going Green
entries.description: Olaf Scholz in front of the decommissioned coal-fired power plant in Saarland, Feb. 1. Photographer: Harald Tittel/picture alliance /Getty Images

entries.title: Complaints to Energy Ombudsman Topped 100,000 Last Year: BBC
entries.description: Complaints from customers to the Energy Ombudsman reportedly numbered more than 100,000 last year.

entries.title: China-Russia Ties Growing, Ministry Says After Official’s Visit
entries.description: China’s strategic partnership with Russia has strong momentum and will continue to grow, the government said on Saturday in a statement that confirmed Vice Foreign Minister Ma Zhaoxu had visited Russia this week.

entries.title: Thousands Mistake US Research Balloon for Chinese Spy Craft
entries.description: A high-altitude research balloon from the US is now among the world’s most-tracked aircraft, after thousands of internet users mistook it for the suspected Chinese surveillance balloon floating over the western state of Montana.

entries.title: Japan’s Kishida Removes Aide Over Same-Sex Union Remarks
entries.description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida dismissed a secretary from his position after remarks criticizing same-sex marriage, Kyodo News reported.

entries.title: Another Balloon Is Flying Over Latin America, Pentagon Says
entries.description: Another Chinese surveillance balloon is flying over Latin America, according to a Defense Department statement on Friday night.

entries.title: From China to Big Sky: The Balloon That Unnerved the White House
entries.description: Star gazing is nothing unusual in Montana, where skies go on forever. But as Chase Doak left work on a Wednesday and looked up on a cold winter day he saw a mysterious round white object that was clearly neither the moon or a star.

entries.title: Bolsonaro Takes Post-Presidency Florida Tour to a Trump Resort
entries.description: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro is again marshaling supporters in Florida, saying he’s puzzled that he lost last fall’s election and giving no indication that he intends to leave the US.

entries.title: This Week in China: The World’s Best Stocks Need New Buyers
entries.description: China’s all-or-nothing stock market is losing momentum, after three months of what might be best described as forced buying of a deeply oversold asset.

entries.title: ANZ Bank Chief Sees a ‘Lot More Rate Rises’ Coming in Australia
entries.description: The chief of one of Australia’s largest commercial banks warned the strength of the nation’s economy suggests that markets and home owners should brace for “a lot more rate rises.”

entries.title: China's Covid Testing Booths Get Second Life as Libraries and Food Stalls
entries.description: Local governments are finding new purposes for thousands of testing booths, unwelcome relics of Covid Zero.
